abstract: The Cenozoic fossil record of land snails in Jamaica consists of numerous deposits of Quaternary age and a single pre-Quaternary depositâ€”the Bowden shell bed, a marine deposit of early Pliocene age. Analysis of the amounts and D/L ratios of amino acids in Bowden land snails indicates that some of the material is actually of late Holocene age. Only four species can confidently be assigned stratigraphically to the Bowden shell bed; all are extinct, but most belong to extant species groups endemic to the island.
